Class ScrollActor

java.lang.Object
greenfoot.Actor
ScrollActor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Beach, BorderForest, Box, DialogLine, DialogManager, Door, Home, Mission, MissionDisplay, MissionManager, MoneyDisplay, MoneyManager, NPC, Objects, Path, Player, TreeTop, VillageObject, Wallet, ZakatInteraction
public abstract class ScrollActor extends greenfoot.Actor
An actor which ca be in a ScrollWorld. It has 3 types of locations:
  • A location where it really is. That means, the location the space the camera is moving over. This is the most important one. Access it by the getGlobalX() and the getGlobalY() methods.
  • A location seen from the camera. This means when it's at
    invalid @link 
    {@link 0,0
    }, it is at the center of what you see. Access it by the getXFromCamera() and the getYFromCamera() methods.
  • A location on screen. This is what you would do in your usual scenarios, so
    invalid @link 
    {@link 0,0
    } is the top left corner. With this library, it is the least important one. Access it by the usual Actor.getX() and Actor.getY() methods.
    • Version:
    2.1.5
    Author:
    Sven van Nigtevecht

      • setLocation

        public void setLocation(int x, int y)
        Sets your location seen from the world (regular location). That means that a negative location is off screen, and bigger than the world's size is also off screen.
        Overrides:
        setLocation in class greenfoot.Actor

      • getWorld

        public ScrollWorld getWorld()
        Returns the ScrollWorld you're in. If you're not in a world, this will return null.
        Overrides:
        getWorld in class greenfoot.Actor

      • move

        public void move(int distance)
        Moves the scroll actor forward a specified amount. To go backwards, enter a negative number.

        This will affect all the locations of the scroll actor.

        Overrides:
        move in class greenfoot.Actor
        Parameters:
        distance - The number of cells the scroll actor will move forward.

      • turnTowardsGlobalLocation

        y - The y coördinate of the location.

        y - The y coördinate of the location.

      • isCameraFollower

        public boolean isCameraFollower()
        Returns you're a camera follower or not. If you're not in a world, this will throw an exception.
